properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected. A period of freezing rain is expected this morning. In areas of higher terrain, freezing rain may continue into the early afternoon. Ice accretion of 2 to 4 millimeters is anticipated with this event. Ice build-up is likely on elevated surfaces. Untreated surfaces such as roads, particularly bridges and overpasses, and walkways may also become icy. ### Poor weather conditions may contribute to transportation delays. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-05T17:41:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-05T08:42:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0362861171.2019
Area: Woodstock - Tillsonburg - Oxford County, Brantford - County of Brant, Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, City of Hamilton, Bruce Peninsula - Sauble Beach - Tobermory, Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County, Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Listowel - Milverton - Northern Perth County, Stratford - Mitchell - Southern Perth County, Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Guelph - Erin - Southern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County, Caledon, Halton Hills - Milton
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: DUST ADVISORY ISSUED FOR GOLDEN April 4, 2019 - Vernon. The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy, in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority, has issued a Dust Advisory for Golden due to high concentrations of coarse particulates, which are expected to persist until there is a change in current weather conditions. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Staying indoors and in air-conditioned spaces helps to reduce particulate exposure. Exposure is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-04-05T13:29:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-04-05T05:30:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2520071228.2019
Area: East Columbia
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Variable conditions are expected tonight, with potential for persistent snow squalls. Flurries and local snow squalls are expected to persist tonight and will combine with strong winds and falling temperatures to create areas of poor visibility in blowing snow. The potential exists for some of the squalls to become more persistent, resulting in localized near-blizzard conditions. An improving trend is expected for Friday. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-05T16:59:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-05T01:37:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2911993463.2019
Area: Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain likely this morning. Precipitation moving into Southern Ontario early this morning may begin as or change to freezing rain as temperatures are near or below freezing. The freezing rain could last for a few hours before temperatures rise above the freezing mark. Ice build-up is possible on elevated surfaces. Untreated surfaces such as roads, especially bridges and overpasses, and walkways may also become icy. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-05T15:57:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-05T07:58:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2057518580.2019

properties.Title: Update Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Village Of Paynton.
properties.Summary:
Description: UPDATE A precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Paynton. This advisory is for the entire community and for individuals who may have access water from the Village of Paynton water system. This advisory has been extended and will remain in effect until April 10, 2019.
Expires: 2019-04-10T18:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Paynton, 2019-04-04T18:39:23-06:00, 931F8533-1A1D-41B4-26B8-CC9B6F146A48
Area: Village of Paynton
properties.Author: SK Paynton

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Variable conditions in snow squalls. A brisk west to southwesterly flow will continue to generate flurries and snow squalls today. The freshly fallen snow will combine with gusty winds and cold temperatures to produce blizzard-like conditions at times, with poor visibilities in blowing snow. The flurries and squalls are expected to gradually weaken during the day today, with clearing skies to follow tonight. Accumulations will vary considerably depending on the locations of the more intense squalls, with additional amounts of up to 5 cm. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-05T21:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-05T10:11:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1201121152.2019
Area: Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Corner Brook and vicinity, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong northwesterly winds with gusts to 100 km/h can be expected today. The strong gusts are forecast to diminish below warning criteria by this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-05T23:01:25-00:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A storm over the Labrador coast is maintaining high westerly winds gusting up to 100 km/h over portions of the northern shore of the Gaspe Peninsula. These winds will diminish gradually beginning this morning. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southwesterly winds gusting up to 100 km/h will gradually ease to westerlies gusting to 80 km/h overnight or early Friday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Flurries and strong westerly winds with gusts betweeen 80 and 100 km/h will combine to cause reduced visibilities in blowing snow again today. Conditions will improve this evening as flurries taper off and winds begin to ease. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-05T22:59:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-05T09:56:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1525516247.2019

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A storm over the Labrador coast is giving strong to high winds which are causing local blowing snow significantly reducing visibilities. Conditions will improve overnight. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
